summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing an upcoming legal proceeding in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It mentions a 'Nolle conference' scheduled before Judge Berman, indicating pre-trial or procedural activity shortly after Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge before whom a 'Nolle conference' in the Epstein case is scheduled.

events.title: Nolle conference in Epstein case
events.description: Scheduled legal conference, described as the 'first ever' in the Epstein case, to be held before Judge Berman.

keyFacts: A 'Nolle conference' in the Epstein case was scheduled for Tuesday, August 27, 2019, at 10:30 AM.
The conference was to be held before Judge Berman.
The email chain is dated August 23-24, 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
The document shows internal DOJ email correspondence regarding case updates.
The term 'first ever' suggests this was a novel or initial procedural step in this specific case.
